peripheral.name: USB0
peripheral.description: Universal Serial Bus, OTG Capable Controller (USB0)

field.name: ID
field.description: Peripheral Identification

field.name: NID
field.description: Ones complement of peripheral identification bits

field.name: REV
field.description: Revision

field.name: IEHOST
field.description: When this bit is set, the USB peripheral is operating in host mode

field.name: IRQNUM
field.description: Assigned Interrupt Request Number

field.name: AVBUSCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device

field.name: B_SESS_CHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device

field.name: SESSVLDCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid

field.name: LINE_STATE_CHG
field.description: This bit is set when the USB line state changes. The interrupt associated with this bit can be used to detect Reset, Resume, Connect, and Data Line Pulse signaling

field.name: ONEMSEC
field.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires. This bit stays asserted until cleared by software. The interrupt must be serviced every millisecond to avoid losing 1msec counts

field.name: IDCHG
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed

field.name: AVBUSEN
field.description: A VBUS Valid Interrupt Enable

field.name: BSESSEN
field.description: B Session END Interrupt Enable

field.name: SESSVLDEN
field.description: Session Valid Interrupt Enable

field.name: LINESTATEEN
field.description: Line State Change Interrupt Enable

field.name: ONEMSECEN
field.description: One Millisecond Interrupt Enable

field.name: IDEN
field.description: ID Interrupt Enable

field.name: AVBUSVLD
field.description: A VBUS Valid

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the A VBUS Valid threshold

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the A VBUS Valid threshold

field.name: BSESSEND
field.description: B Session End

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the B session end threshold

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the B session end threshold

field.name: SESS_VLD
field.description: Session Valid

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is below the B session valid threshold

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The VBUS voltage is above the B session valid threshold

field.name: LINESTATESTABLE
field.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond. First read LINE_STATE_CHG field and then read this field. If this field reads as 1, then the value of LINE_STATE_CHG can be considered stable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit is not yet stable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit has been debounced and is stable

field.name: ONEMSECEN
field.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software

field.name: ID
field.description: Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates a Type A cable is plugged into the USB connector

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Indicates no cable is attached or a Type B cable is plugged into the USB connector

field.name: OTGEN
field.description: On-The-Go pullup/pulldown resistor enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: If USB_EN is 1 and HOST_MODE is 0 in the Control Register (CTL), then the D+ Data Line pull-up resistors are enabled. If HOST_MODE is 1 the D+ and D- Data Line pull-down resistors are engaged

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The pull-up and pull-down controls in this register are used

field.name: DMLOW
field.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: D- pulldown resistor is not enabled

field.name: DPLOW
field.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: D+ pulldown resistor is not enabled

field.name: DPHIGH
field.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: D+ pullup resistor is not enabled

field.name: USBRST
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset. This informs the processor that it should write 0x00 into the address register and enable endpoint 0. USBRST is set after a USB reset has been detected for 2.5 microseconds. It is not asserted again until the USB reset condition has been removed and then reasserted

field.name: ERROR
field.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur. The processor must then read the ERRSTAT register to determine the source of the error

field.name: SOFTOK
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token. In Host mode this field is set when the SOF threshold is reached, so that software can prepare for the next SOF

field.name: TOKDNE
field.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed. The processor should immediately read the STAT register to determine the EndPoint and BD used for this token. Clearing this bit (by writing a one) causes the STAT register to be cleared or the STAT holding register to be loaded into the STAT register

field.name: SLEEP
field.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms. The sleep timer is reset by activity on the USB bus

field.name: RESUME
field.description: This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus. When not in suspend mode this interrupt must be disabled

field.name: ATTACH
field.description: Attach Interrupt

field.name: STALL
field.description: Stall Interrupt

field.name: USBRSTEN
field.description: USBRST Interrupt Enable

field.name: ERROREN
field.description: ERROR Interrupt Enable

field.name: SOFTOKEN
field.description: SOFTOK Interrupt Enable

field.name: TOKDNEEN
field.description: TOKDNE Interrupt Enable

field.name: SLEEPEN
field.description: SLEEP Interrupt Enable

field.name: RESUMEEN
field.description: RESUME Interrupt Enable

field.name: ATTACHEN
field.description: ATTACH Interrupt Enable

field.name: STALLEN
field.description: STALL Interrupt Enable

field.name: PIDERR
field.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails

field.name: CRC5EOF
field.description: This error interrupt has two functions. When the USB Module is operating in peripheral mode (HOSTMODEEN=0), this interrupt detects CRC5 errors in the token packets generated by the host. If set the token packet was rejected due to a CRC5 error. When the USB Module is operating in host mode (HOSTMODEEN=1), this interrupt detects End Of Frame (EOF) error conditions. This occurs when the USB Module is transmitting or receiving data and the SOF counter reaches zero. This interrupt is useful when developing USB packet scheduling software to ensure that no USB transactions cross the start of the next frame

field.name: CRC16
field.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error

field.name: DFN8
field.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length. USB Specification 1.0 requires that data fields be an integral number of bytes. If the data field was not an integral number of bytes, this bit is set

field.name: BTOERR
field.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs. The USB module contains a bus turnaround timer that keeps track of the amount of time elapsed between the token and data phases of a SETUP or OUT TOKEN or the data and handshake phases of a IN TOKEN. If more than 16 bit times are counted from the previous EOP before a transition from IDLE, a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

field.name: DMAERR
field.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data. If processing a TX transfer this would cause a transmit data underflow condition. If processing a RX transfer this would cause a receive data overflow condition. This interrupt is useful when developing device arbitration hardware for the microprocessor and the USB Module to minimize bus request and bus grant latency. This bit is also set if a data packet to or from the host is larger than the buffer size allocated in the BDT. In this case the data packet is truncated as it is put into buffer memory

field.name: BTSERR
field.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected. If set, the corresponding packet is rejected due to the error

field.name: PIDERREN
field.description: PIDERR Interrupt Enable

field.name: CRC5EOFEN
field.description: CRC5/EOF Interrupt Enable

field.name: CRC16EN
field.description: CRC16 Interrupt Enable

field.name: DFN8EN
field.description: DFN8 Interrupt Enable

field.name: BTOERREN
field.description: BTOERR Interrupt Enable

field.name: DMAERREN
field.description: DMAERR Interrupt Enable

field.name: BTSERREN
field.description: BTSERR Interrupt Enable

field.name: ODD
field.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT

field.name: TX
field.description: Transmit Indicator

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: The most recent transaction was a receive operation

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: The most recent transaction was a transmit operation

field.name: ENDP
field.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token. This allows the processor core to determine the BDT entry that was updated by the last USB transaction

field.name: USBENSOFEN
field.description: USB Enable

field.name: ODDRST
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

field.name: RESUME
field.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling. This allows the USB Module to perform remote wake-up. Software must set RESUME to 1 for the required amount of time and then clear it to 0. If the HOSTMODEEN bit is set, the USB module appends a Low Speed End of Packet to the Resume signaling when the RESUME bit is cleared. For more information on RESUME signaling see Section 7.1.4.5 of the USB specification version 1.0

field.name: HOSTMODEEN
field.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode. In host mode, the USB module performs USB transactions under the programmed control of the host processor

field.name: RESET
field.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling. This allows the USB Module to reset USB peripherals. This control signal is only valid in Host mode (HOSTMODEEN=1). Software must set RESET to 1 for the required amount of time and then clear it to 0 to end reset signaling. For more information on RESET signaling see Section 7.1.4.3 of the USB specification version 1.0

field.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY
field.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token. Software must not write more token commands to the Token Register when TOKEN_BUSY is set.. Software should check this field before writing any tokens to the Token Register to ensure that token commands are not lost. In Target mode, TXD_SUSPEND is set when the SIE has disabled packet transmission and reception. Clearing this bit allows the SIE to continue token processing. This bit is set by the SIE when a SETUP Token is received allowing software to dequeue any pending packet transactions in the BDT before resuming token processing

field.name: SE0
field.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

field.name: JSTATE
field.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

field.name: ADDR
field.description: USB Address

field.name: LSEN
field.description: Low Speed Enable bit

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: This field provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address

field.name: FRM
field.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

field.name: FRM
field.description: This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

field.name: TOKENENDPT
field.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command. The four bit value written must be a valid endpoint

field.name: TOKENPID
field.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0001
enumeratedValue.description: OUT Token. USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1001
enumeratedValue.description: IN Token. USB Module performs an In (RX) transaction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1101
enumeratedValue.description: SETUP Token. USB Module performs a SETUP (TX) transaction

field.name: CNT
field.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

field.name: EPHSHK
field.description: When set this bet enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint. This bit is generally 1 unless the endpoint is Isochronous

field.name: EPSTALL
field.description: When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is called. This bit has priority over all other control bits in the EndPoint Enable Register, but it is only valid if EPTXEN=1 or EPRXEN=1. Any access to this endpoint causes the USB Module to return a STALL handshake. After an endpoint is stalled it requires intervention from the Host Controller

field.name: EPTXEN
field.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers

field.name: EPRXEN
field.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers

field.name: EPCTLDIS
field.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers. When cleared, control transfers are enabled. This applies if and only if the EPRXEN and EPTXEN bits are also set

field.name: RETRYDIS
field.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only. When set this bit causes the host to not retry NAK'ed (Negative Acknowledgement) transactions. When a transaction is NAKed, the BDT PID field is updated with the NAK PID, and the TOKEN_DNE interrupt is set. When this bit is cleared NAKed transactions is retried in hardware. This bit must be set when the host is attempting to poll an interrupt endpoint

field.name: HOSTWOHUB
field.description: This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only. When set this bit allows the host to communicate to a directly connected low speed device. When cleared, the host produces the PRE_PID. It then switches to low-speed signaling when sends a token to a low speed device as required to communicate with a low speed device through a hub

field.name: PDE
field.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-

field.name: SUSP
field.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: USB transceiver is in suspend state

field.name: DMPD
field.description: Provides observability of the D- Pull Down enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPD
field.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pull Down enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPU
field.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pull Up enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
field.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in the USB OTG module, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is not enabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled

field.name: USB_RESUME_INT
field.description: USB Asynchronous Interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Interrupt was generated because of the USB asynchronous interrupt

field.name: SYNC_DET
field.description: Synchronous USB Interrupt Detect

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous interrupt has not been detected

field.name: USBRESMEN
field.description: Asynchronous Resume Interrupt Enable

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode enabled. The asynchronous resume interrupt differs from the synchronous resume interrupt in that it asynchronously detects K-state using the unfiltered state of the D+ and D- pins. This interupt should only be enabled when the Transceiver is suspended

field.name: USBRESET
field.description: USB Reset

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Returns the USB module to its reset state

field.name: ADJ
field.description: Frame Adjustment

register.name: CLK_RECOVER_CTRL
register.description: USB Clock recovery control\n Signals in this register control the crystal-less USB clock mode in which the internal IRC48M oscillator is tuned to match the clock extracted from the incoming USB data stream

field.name: RESTART_IFRTRIM_EN
field.description: Restart from IFR trim value\n IRC48 has a default trim fine value whose default value is factory trimmed (the IFR trim value).\n Clock recover block tracks the accuracy of the clock 48Mhz and keeps updating the trim fine value accordingly

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Trim fine adjustment always works based on the previous updated trim fine value (default)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Trim fine restarts from the IFR trim value whenever bus_reset/bus_resume is detected or module disabled

field.name: RESET_RESUME_ROUGH_EN
field.description: Reset/resume to rough phase enable\n The clock recovery block tracks the IRC48Mhz to get an accurate 48Mhz clock. It has two phases rough phase and tracking phase.\n Switch back to rough stage whenever USB bus reset or bus resume occurs

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Always works in tracking phase after the 1st time rough to track transition (default)

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Go back to rough stage whenever bus reset or bus resume occurs

field.name: CLOCK_RECOVER_EN
field.description: Crystal-less USB enable\n This bit must be enabled if user wants to use the crystal-less USB mode for the Full Speed USB controller and transceiver.\n NOTE: This bit should not be set for USB host mode or OTG

register.name: CLK_RECOVER_IRC_EN
register.description: IRC48M oscillator enable register\n Controls basic operation of the on-chip IRC48M module used to produce a nominal 48MHz clocks for USB crystal-less operation and other functions

field.name: REG_EN
field.description: IRC48M regulator enable\n This bit is used to enable the local analog regulator for IRC48Mhz module.\n This bit must be set if user wants to use the crystal-less USB clock configuration

field.name: IRC_EN
field.description:
IRC48M enable
 This bit is used to enable the on-chip IRC48Mhz module to generate clocks for crystal-less USB. 
 It can only be used for FS USB device mode operation.
 This bit must be set before using the crystal-less USB clock configuration

register.name: CLK_RECOVER_INT_STATUS
register.description: Clock recovery separated interrupt status\n A Write operation with value high at 1'b1 on any combination of individual bits will clear those bits

field.name: OVF_ERROR
field.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the IRC48M output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the IRC48M module
